Hi everybody

I'm trying to consider in the same time the formation of grap=
hite and
liquid water during the combustion of methane.
The error is about =
water. I have modified the python example
"adiabatic.py" and add the water'=
s phase.

my script (python):


from Cantera import*
Temp=3D300
press=3D1*O=
neAtm
Va=3D2
n=3D0.1
Vr=3Dn*Va

phase=3DIdealGasMix('gri30.xml','gri30')
ca=
rbon =3D importPhase('graphite.xml','graphite')
water =3D importPhase('wate=
r.xml','liquid_water')

mix_phases =3D [ (phase, 1.0), (carbon, 0.0), (wate=
r,0.0)]
nsp=3Dphase.nSpecies()

iCH4=3Dphase.speciesIndex('CH4')
iO2=3Dphas=
e.speciesIndex('O2')

x=3Dzeros(nsp,'d')
x[iCH4]=3D1
x[iO2]=3DVr

phase.set=
(T=3D Temp, P =3D press, X=3Dx)
mix=3DMixture(mix_phases)
mix.setTemperatur=
e(Temp)
mix.setPressure(press)


mix.equilibrate("HP", err =3D 1.0e-3, maxs=
teps =3D 20000, maxiter =3D 5000,
loglevel =3D 0)
print mix


And the error=
 :
************************************************
                Cantera=
 Error!                  
************************************************
=


Procedure: MultiPhaseEquil
Error:   condensed-phase speciesH2O(L) is excl=
uded since its thermo
properties are 
not valid at this temperature, but it=
 has non-zero moles in the
initial state.



If i change the initial temper=
ature 300 to 1000, there is no error.
If i change the "HP" option to "TP", =
there is no error (even if the
initial temperature if 1000 K).
